storyInfo: During an ambush, Plume decides to abandon her by-the-books guard training and places her trust in her own abilities as well as those of her teammate.

attributes.text: A cleric, a scientist, a medic, a government worker, a power plant technician...
Leia, what do you want to be when you grow up?
...You want to join the guards? Isn't that an awfully boring job? Like, you'll have to stand at the entrance to the city and try to keep a straight face when someone tells you a joke.
You'll have to get out of bed before sunrise to start your drills. You'll also have to take a ton of tests, and you'll only become a fully-fledged member after passing all of them.
You're not very tall, you're not in very good shape, and you'd struggle to pass those tests, you know.
I see... So, you want to protect others?
Leia, you have a very grand and lofty ideal.

attributes.content: Eastern Columbia Wastelands
Stay calm. We won't be able to use the communicator until the next base station. This is a normal phenomenon.
attributes.name: Firewatch

attributes.content: You didn't break it, nor is it going to get a signal no matter how much you fiddle around with it.
attributes.name: Firewatch

attributes.content: Sure, understood.
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: Seems like you haven't been on many field operations since joining Rhodes Island.
attributes.name: Firewatch

attributes.content: Yes. Sorry. I lack practical experience, so I'll work harder to make up for it.
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: If I remember right, you were one of Laterano's... city guards?
attributes.name: Firewatch

attributes.content: A member of the Guards. Defending Laterano is indeed one of my duties.
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: Er, or rather, was. Now, I'm a Rhodes Island operator.
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: You certainly conduct yourself with the air of a guard. I often see you standing lookout on the deck. The others have taken to calling you 'that Laterano guard'.
attributes.name: Firewatch

attributes.content: I can relate to that sense of vigilance though. There are always lurking threats, even inside the landship.
attributes.name: Firewatch

attributes.content: And it can be an honor to be known by your duties.
attributes.name: Firewatch

attributes.content: That's all in the past now... Well, it wasn't that long ago. But still, I prefer to go by Plume.
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: That said, I'm not really sure how to introduce myself. After coming to Rhodes Island, I never got put in a permanent squad, nor did I get a welcoming party...
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: The work I do here is also very different from what I did in Laterano, and I've been having trouble adjusting.
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: I understand.
attributes.name: Firewatch

attributes.content: —Watch out!
attributes.name: Firewatch

attributes.content: There are snipers nearby. Multiple.
attributes.name: Firewatch

attributes.content: Bandits?
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: Not sure if they're after Rhodes Island, or just wasteland opportunists.
attributes.name: Firewatch

attributes.content: ...Conventional weaponry, judging from this bolt. Looks like they've had their eyes on this logistics escort mission for quite some time now.
attributes.name: Firewatch

attributes.content: There aren't many places to bunker down in this terrain, and the enemy snipers won't have much cover, but setting up my crossbow here is still risky.
attributes.name: Firewatch

attributes.content: I'll protect you. I've received similar training in Laterano, often with squad mates using guns.
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: I'll deal with any attackers who try to close the distance.
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: Alright. Be careful out there.
attributes.name: Firewatch

attributes.content: As long as we're exchanging fire at this range, I'm more than confident in my own weapon's specs.
attributes.name: Firewatch

attributes.content: (Keep moving at high speeds so the enemies can't land a shot.)
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: (Draw their attention away from where Firewatch is hiding.)
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: Ngh!
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: (No problem. This guy's knife doesn't have as much reach as my poleaxe. I can safely handle a frontal attack as well.)
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: (Now, create some distance so the enemy snipers won't feel worried about friendly fire.)
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: (When they make their move, Firewatch will lock on to their positions and return fire.)
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: What?!
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: (They're not aiming for me, but at where Firewatch is lying in ambush?)
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: Huff... Huff...
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: (I'm burning through my stamina... faster than expected...)
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: (Get it together! I need to cover Firewatch while she repositions.)
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: (––No, that's not right.)
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: (So far, I've done everything exactly by the book, like we trained.)
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: (But if I know these tactics by heart, the other side might too.)
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: Before discussing possible interference in Rhodes Island's affairs from rival businesses in Columbia, I'd first like to bring up one of the operators involved in this mission—Plume.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: I just looked up some records, and she's been going on a few too many field operations recently... Actually, her schedule is already tightly packed through the next month.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: I bring this up because although these missions are generally less dangerous, that doesn't mean she's not building up fatigue.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: We could be at significant risk were they to be attacked by a mercenary organization during this escort mission.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: To be honest, nobody noticed that she, uh, submitted so many assignment requests all at once.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: From what I recall, she was never a fan of taking on missions.
attributes.name: Orchid

attributes.content: The last time she went on a mission with Reserve Op Team A6, to rescue Infected children, it was her first field operation. I remember it clearly, because I was the squad leader.
attributes.name: Orchid

attributes.content: Ha, that's right. Even though everyone's seen her around, not many actually know her code name. Most just call her that Laterano guard on the deck.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: It is what it is though. Who told her not to sign up for missions?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: I've tried talking to her before, but she seemed... how to put this... rather aloof?
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: One night, I saw her standing there staring off into the sky. So I asked if she was interested in giving astrology a try. After all, my divinations have earned even the Doctor's recognition.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: Turns out, she didn't even know what astrology is. She listened to my explanation very politely, but didn't seem at all interested.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: Alas, what a terrible shock that was.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: Oh, she was mumbling some mystical mumbo-jumbo the other day. She got that from you then?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: When she accompanied Backfire to Medical two days ago, she was muttering about 'phases' and 'zeniths' and so on. I wanted to slap her out of it, right on the treatment table.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Hm, she may have missed the point somewhat... but I'm glad she at least remembered the words.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: Dr. Gavial, the kids from A6 are afraid to go to Medical for checkups. If you could just work on your bedside manner...
attributes.name: Orchid

attributes.content: No can do. If they're afraid of the croc doc, that's THEIR problem. Psychologically speaking.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Speaking of which, did the members of A6 work well with Plume on that one operation you had together?
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: Extremely. She's a very well-trained fighter. To be honest, I wish the rest of the team would take orders half as well as she did...
attributes.name: Orchid

attributes.content: And on the way back, she was very enthusiastic about teaching Catapult and Popukar how to write an operation report.
attributes.name: Orchid

attributes.content: However, she never offered any of her own opinions until the mission debriefing. If she'd taken initiative during the operation itself, things might've gone even better...
attributes.name: Orchid

attributes.content: Maybe she found the members of A6 too unreliable, and didn't dare suggest changing plans in the middle of battle.
attributes.name: Orchid

attributes.content: She's too rigid. We're not the army here, and our main advantage comes from our flexibility to adjust to any changes.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Oh right, from what I've heard of other operations, you used to be the leader of a tribe, right? You must've been good at leading large groups... and large fights?
attributes.name: Orchid

attributes.content: Heh, you spend way too much time rubbing shoulders with the folks in HR.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: But my past's not as simple as that...
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Phew...
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: (Charge forward again, then retreat in the direction of Firewatch.)
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: Hah, tricked them.
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: Enemy sniper down. Plume, create some distance.
attributes.name: Firewatch

attributes.content: On it.
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: The attackers have been dealt with.
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: A job well done.
attributes.name: Firewatch

attributes.content: You led them towards where I was hiding, not away.
attributes.name: Firewatch

attributes.content: This threw off their intuitions, confusing them into thinking I was hiding elsewhere.
attributes.name: Firewatch

attributes.content: When snipers face off in the open wilderness, the moment someone reveals their position with their attention on the wrong spot... they're done for.
attributes.name: Firewatch

attributes.content: Your quick thinking was both brave and incredibly smart.
attributes.name: Firewatch

attributes.content: Uh... thank you. I was about to apologize for acting on my own though.
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: That strategy could've put you at risk, and we didn't agreed on it beforehand.
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: I was supposed to cover you, but ended up doing the exact opposite.
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: No, I'm very glad that you chose in the moment to put your faith in me and trust my abilities.
attributes.name: Firewatch

attributes.content: Yes, it's something another senior at Rhodes Island taught me before.
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: She said she hoped I could trust my companions more, as well as... my own judgment.
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: I—
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: What's wrong? Are you hurt?
attributes.name: Firewatch

attributes.content: Huff... I'm fine, I probably just pushed myself too hard.
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: Head back to the vehicle first and rest then. We'll make our way to the en route safe house ASAP, then report this attack to the Rhodes Island landship.
attributes.name: Firewatch

attributes.content: Let me help. That weapon of yours might be a bit too heavy for you right now.
attributes.name: Firewatch

attributes.content: Huff... Thanks...
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: But I can handle my own poleaxe. I've trained with it so much that it's basically a part of me.
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: I can tell that you're academy-trained.
attributes.name: Firewatch

attributes.content: You're quick to respond to surprise attacks, take action without hesitation, and can nimbly find cover while in the line of fire of two different snipers.
attributes.name: Firewatch

attributes.content: But I don't think any academy would teach a poleaxe user to sacrifice the weapon's power and rely on speed.
attributes.name: Firewatch

attributes.content: You're right, I didn't follow the standard guard training.
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: The seniors in my squad privately suggested that I offset my weaknesses by bolstering my strengths, so I incorporated some tricks into my fighting style and barely passed the course.
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: A very good tradeoff, if you ask me.
attributes.name: Firewatch

attributes.content: Have you ever considered taking up a different weapon though?
attributes.name: Firewatch

attributes.content: Most of the guard forces used poleaxes.
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: Hm... Of course, that's your decision to make.
attributes.name: Firewatch

attributes.content: But since you've already found your personal style, it shouldn't be a problem either way.
attributes.name: Firewatch

attributes.content: Have you recovered a little?
attributes.name: Firewatch

attributes.content: I drank some saline water and already feel a lot better.
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: I did make a mistake earlier, which made me burn through my stamina too quickly. I wasn't pacing myself at the start of the fight.
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: What you remind me of—from what I'm familiar with at least—is a prey animal that's been hunted day and night. Have you gotten enough rest lately?
attributes.name: Firewatch

attributes.content: Huh? I don't have anything like that going on.
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: As a matter of fact, it feels really fulfilling to have a duty to carry out each and every day.
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: Every day?
attributes.name: Firewatch

attributes.content: Mhm. When I first came to Rhodes Island, I had no idea what I was supposed to be doing. Recently, I realized that I should be taking the initiative to apply for missions.
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: While I can more or less understand how you feel...
attributes.name: Firewatch

attributes.content: Going on too many field operations is unreasonable. You need rest, and your weapon needs maintenance too.
attributes.name: Firewatch

attributes.content: Have you even been to the Engineering Department since coming to Rhodes Island?
attributes.name: Firewatch

attributes.content: Huh? No, but I think my weapon is in pretty good shape.
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: Don't worry, the craftspeople here are familiar with Laterano weapons. There are several masters in the repair shop who can fix even guns with ease.
attributes.name: Firewatch

attributes.content: They might even be able to give you some ideas on how to upgrade your poleaxe to make it more comfortable.
attributes.name: Firewatch

attributes.content: Good idea. I'll keep that in mind.
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: Honestly, I've been thinking the same thing. My weapon could use some modifications, since our tasks here are so different from the guard forces.
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: Let's get a move on. The sun's starting to set, and we need to reach the safe house before dark.
attributes.name: Firewatch

attributes.content: And that's a full overview of the field operation. After dispatching the ambushers at the outset, we encountered no other threats.
attributes.name: Firewatch

attributes.content: The attackers were obviously mercenaries, and I've collected the bolts they used. Unfortunately, this information alone cannot reveal the identity of whoever's behind this.
attributes.name: Firewatch

attributes.content: I'll leave them here with the report, Doctor. If you have no other questions, I'll take my leave.
attributes.name: Firewatch

attributes.content: I'll also–
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.options: Someone from HR wants to talk to you.

attributes.content: Alright... I'm honored that you remember my code name, Doctor.
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: Your application to serve as the Doctor's bodyguard has been carefully reviewed.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: Unfortunately, the Doctor has decided that a personal bodyguard is unnecessary while aboard the Rhodes Island landship.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: Oh, that's something I sent out earlier...
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: Um... Thank you for your time and patience. I'm sorry that my abilities are not up to par...
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: Ahem... You don't need to take it that seriously, Plume.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: The good news is that you've been recognized for your performance in recent field missions, and the Doctor will need escorts when conducting operations away from the ship.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: In other words, I got the job?
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: That's right.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: That said, one of our operators reported that you've been applying for an unusually high number of field missions. As HR Department staff, I need to know the reason.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: Although you've been pretty tight-lipped about your past, you did come with those two Laterano operators after all...
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: I don't know what they've been through, nor do I have the right to ask.
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: What I'm trying to say is that I've heard a word or two about your pre-Rhodes Island situation from them.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: Uh, the way they put it was that they 'felt bad for you because you seemed so lost and directionless all the time,' which is why they brought you out of Laterano.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: Considering that you still value Laterano glory, but have been dismissed from the guard forces, I would like to confirm your motives for taking on these recent field missions.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: Are you regretting the decision you made at the time?
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: No, I don't regret it... At least not anymore.
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: I can trust my own judgment now. In the face of life and death, the rules can be bent.
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: And after coming to Rhodes Island, I realized that people with Oripathy don't infect others simply by walking down the street, nor are they just waiting for death to come.
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: Seeing how Backfire is still alive and conscious, can still participate in training, and can still talk to the captain as energetically as before... It truly makes me happy.
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: I've also come to terms with the fact that I can't go back to the Laterano Guards. Rhodes Island and Laterano are completely different places, and I've also had to change.
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: Plus, I'm really fascinated by the things people talk about here, even if I don't fully understand them.
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: In my experience, field missions give me more opportunities to work with my teammates, and should help me better integrate into the group.
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: About that... Actually, many operators bond over common interests, such as Pinecone's woodcrafting group, or Vigna's band...
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: Speaking of which, they seem to be missing a bass player right now?
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: Mm... Thanks for letting me know. I'll think about it.
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: By the way, Firewatch recommended the 'Vitafield' clothing brand to me. I heard they're currently in a business relationship with us. Can you tell me more about it?
attributes.name: Plume

attributes.content: Eh... Plume?
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.options: Go ahead and show her around.;I think we're done with the serious stuff.

attributes.content: Um, alright, if it's fine with you, Doctor. I'll go grab one of my colleagues then.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator
